Reformat Imputed Data

recode_imputed_data.Rd

By default, the recoding creates a set of new variables for each demographic and childhood predictor variable with the prefix "COV_".

method.income has several options. * 'quintiles.num.fixed', 'quintiles.num.random' use survey::svyquantile() to identify the country specific categories that separate responses into quintiles. This is only approximate however because the categories are coarse and the top 20 * 'quintiles.top.fixed', ”quintiles.top.random' use the * 'numeric

More to come...

Usage

recode_imputed_data(
  df.imp = NULL,
  list.default = NULL,
  list.composites = NULL,
  list.manual = NULL,
  wave = 2,
  method.income = "quintiles.top.fixed",
  ...
)

Arguments

df.imp

a nested data.frame with results from run_impute_data(.).

list.default

(required) a names list with DEMOGRAPHICS.CHILDHOOD.PRED.VEC, OUTCOME.VE, FOCAL_PREDICTOR, USE_DEFAULT, FORCE_BINARY, VALUES_DEFINING_UPPER_CATEGORY, VALUES_DEFINING_LOWER_CATEGORY, FORCE_CONTINUOUS

list.composites

(optional) a named list with elements LIST.OUTCOME.COMPOSITES, LIST.COMPOSITE.COMBINE.METHOD and COMPOSITE.VEC.

list.manual

(optional) a list like list.default (to-do)

wave

(default is wave 2) but can be coerced to use wave 1 data (use wave = 1 to appropriately utilize recoding of wave 1 data)

method.income

(optional) method for how income, based on country specific labels, is recoded. Options include 'quintiles.num.fixed', 'quintiles.num.random', 'quintiles.top.fixed', ”quintiles.top.random', 'numeric'.

...

other arguments passed to mice

Value

a long data.frame for use in analyses

Details

Reformated the imputed (nested) data for use in coordinated regression analyses.

Examples

{
  # none
}
#> NULL
